page.title: 12THE LERWICK LIFE BOAT
page.content: ON WEDNESDAY 22nd MAY WE ALL WENT ON A TRIP TO SEE THE{LERWICK LIFEBOAT.}THE BOAT'S NAME IS{'SOLDIAN'}SHE WAS BUILT IN 1980 AND COST Â£380,000. TO BUILD A SIMILAR BOAT NOW WOULD COST Â£400,000. THE SOLDIAN IS AN{ARUN CLASS LIFEBOAT} AND THE COXSWAIN IS HEWITT CLARK. THERE ARE FIVE REGULAR CREW MEMBERS WITH 8-10 RESERVES.IN ROUGH WEATHER THE SOLDIAN CAN CARRY 31 SURVIVORS BUT IN GOOD WEATHER SHE CAN CARRY 160 SURVIVORS. IF IN BAD WEATHER THE BOAT TURNS OVER SHE IMMEDIATELY RIGHTS HERSELF.SHE HAS A CRUISING SPEED OF 16.84 KNOTS AND A MAXIMUM SPEED OF 18.14 KNOTS. FUEL CONSUMPTION IS 45 GALLONS PER HOUR. THE HULL CONSTRUCTION IS GLASS REINFORCED PLASTIC, THERE ARE 29 WATER TIGHT COMPARTMENTS. IN THE COCKPIT WE SAW THE RADAR SET,RADIOS,DECCA SET,SIRENS AND LAMP FOR USE IN EMERGENCIES.
